intro: Tauschia coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's tauschia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Tauschia coulteri is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions.
